references.paper_title: A-bench: Are lmms masters at evaluating ai-generated images?
references.reason: This paper contributes to the area of evaluation in AI generated content, assessing the AI models that can act as evaluators.

references.paper_title: Q-Align: Teaching Imms for visual scoring via discrete text-defined levels.
references.reason: This paper is related to image scoring using text as a measure of quality, which is a useful background for alignment with the proposed work.

references.paper_title: Human preference score v2: A solid benchmark for evaluating human preferences of text-to-image synthesis.
references.reason: This work is important for establishing a solid way to evaluate human preferences in text-to-image synthesis.

references.paper_title: ImageReward: Learning and evaluating human preferences for text-to-image generation.
references.reason: This paper provides a useful methodology for evaluating human preferences in text-to-image generation with learned rewards.

references.paper_title: Pick-a-pic: An open dataset of user preferences for text-to-image generation.
references.reason: This paper shares an open dataset about user preferences for text-to-image generation, something critical for quality assessment.
